lines.text: Ten billion ants in this world, and I'm having trouble with just one.

[after the nurse at the vet gives him porridge]
Porridge. Who does she think I am, Goldilocks? Ant eators only eat ants. And that's an ant.

[after swallowing the ant and getting hit by a car. They are both in hospital beds]
Boy, I sure got the Ant knocked out of me that time.
You ain't just a whistlin' tiptoe through the tulips.

[after dropping a stick of dynamite into the anthill]
Hey ant. What do you think of that?

[blows up in his face]
I know what I think of that. But I shouldn't say it in public.
If I had as many friends as that ant, I'd run for governor.
Hi there. How'd it go?
You might say it was a smashing... failure. And by the way, for a computer, you stink!
Who said I was a computer? I'm an automatic pop up toaster. And I'll prove it.
[toast pops out, burying aardvark to the neck in toast]

[to the audience]
Anybody got a pound of butter?

Hello there. Allow me to introduce myself. I'm an aardvark. I eat ants for a living. I'm a functional creation. Check the profile. That's a profile? And the mouth. Ever see a mouth like this? Let me show you how it works. Say there's an ant beyond that hill. I give a little inhale, like this
[inhales, sounding like a vacuum and drains a lake]

[spits out a fish]
Fish phooey! I'm an anteater. Not a fisheater!
Boy, some hospital. The hospitality around here could make a person sick.

[after the Aardvark has surgery to get the Ant out of his stomach]
You bad ol' Aardvark.

[Removes his shirt to reveal a bandage on his stomach where he had surgery]
It hurt me worse than it hurt you. Believe me.
I'm gonna get you, ant.
Slow down, ant! You run off all your fat!
I hate you, instant hole!
the word is *stop*!
Anybody know a good tailor? I think I need a new tail.

[yet another of his schemes backfires]
I'd say something right now, but it would only be censored.
Maybe I should have been a doctor. Then I could prescribe myself a pill.
Believe me, it's no fun being an aardvark. I'd rather be a banker, and have a businessman's lunch. Instead, I have to catch things like him!
[points to Ant]
Believe me, it's no fun being an aardvark. I'd rather be a banker, and have a businessman's lunch. Instead, I have to catch things like him!
[points to Ant]

[standing next to him]
I'm an ant. And he's an anteater. And do you know, what an ol' ant does when he sees an anteater?
[in scary voice]
He runs for his life, man
[runs away]
